The percentage of mail: in ballots rejected in Georgia due to signature issues in the 2020 election was similar to the rejection rates in the 2016 and 2018 general elections.
President Donald Trump: s tweet comparing the number of ballots rejected for signature issues in the 2020 election to the number of ballots rejected in past elections for all reasons is misleading and baseless.
Georgia has not released data on the tot: in ballots rejected, but the percentage of rejection due to signature issues is comparable to the 2018 midterm and slightly lower than the 2016 presidential election.
The rejection rate for signature issues: 0.15%) was nearly identical to the rate in the 2018 election (0.16%), indicating consistency rather than a significant increase in rejection.
